required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Screening for Obstructive Sleep Apnea Among Members of an Internet Weight Loss Community
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of a Web-Based Presentation on Communication With Healthcare Providers

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: The current study was a pilot, double blind, randomized controlled trial to (1) evaluate the feasibility of an online obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) screening intervention, (2) estimate effect size for planning of future studies, and (3) test the hypothesis that the intervention, compared to a control condition, would lead more individuals to discuss OSA with their healthcare provider.

primary_outcome.measure: Online questionnaire asking whether subject has discussed OSA with healthcare provider since enrolling in study

secondary_outcome.measure: Online questionnaire asking whether subject has plans to discuss OSA with healthcare provider, if not done already
Online questionnaire asking whether subject has undergone testing and treatment for OSA since enrolling in study

arm_group.description: Brief, theory-based, online assessment of OSA risk followed by risk-tailed OSA presentation.

intervention.description: Brief, theory-based, online assessment of OSA risk followed by risk-tailed OSA presentation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Member of SparkPeople.com community and logged on within previous month
- Live in the US
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior diagnosis of OSA
- Prior discussions with healthcare provider about OSA

overall_official.affiliation: University of Texas Medical School, Houston

facility.name: University of Texas Medical School, Houston

responsible_party.name_title: Kevin O. Hwang, M.D., M.P.H. (principle investigator)
responsible_party.organization: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston
